00052 // DEBUGGING MACROS:
00053 //
00054 // DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG)
00055 //     MSG  = message to print
00056 //     NAME = name that must match the process for the message to print, or
00057 //            null if the message should be printed unconditionally.
00058 //     P    = pointer to process message is for, or NULL in which case the
00059 //            message will not print.
00060 #if 0
00061 #   include <cstring>
00062 #   define DEBUG_NAME ""
00063 #   define DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG) \
00064     { \
00065         if ( P && ( (std::strlen(NAME)==0) || !std::strcmp(NAME,P->name())) ) \
00066           std::cout << "**** " << sc_time_stamp() << " ("  \
00067                     << sc_get_current_process_name("** NONE **") << "): " << MSG \
00068                     << " - " << P->name() << std::endl; \
00069     }
00070 #else
00071 #   define DEBUG_MSG(NAME,P,MSG) 
00072 #endif

00099 //==============================================================================
00100 // sc_method_process -
00101 //
00102 //==============================================================================
00103 class sc_method_process : public sc_process_b {
00104     friend struct sc_invoke_method; 
00105     friend void sc_method_cor_fn( void* );
00106     friend void sc_cmethod_cor_fn( void* );
00107     friend void sc_set_stack_size( sc_method_handle, std::size_t );
00108     friend class sc_event;
00109     friend class sc_module;
00110     friend class sc_process_table;
00111     friend class sc_process_handle;
00112     friend class sc_simcontext;
00113     friend class sc_runnable;
00114 
00115     friend void next_trigger( sc_simcontext* );
00116     friend void next_trigger( const sc_event&,
00117                   sc_simcontext* );
00118     friend void next_trigger( const sc_event_or_list&,
00119                   sc_simcontext* );
00120     friend void next_trigger( const sc_event_and_list&,
00121                   sc_simcontext* );
00122     friend void next_trigger( const sc_time&,
00123                   sc_simcontext* );
00124     friend void next_trigger( const sc_time&, const sc_event&,
00125                   sc_simcontext* );
00126     friend void next_trigger( const sc_time&, const sc_event_or_list&,
00127                   sc_simcontext* );
00128     friend void next_trigger( const sc_time&, const sc_event_and_list&,
00129                   sc_simcontext* );
00130 
00131   public:
00132     sc_method_process( const char* name_p, bool free_host,
00133         SC_ENTRY_FUNC method_p, sc_process_host* host_p, 
00134         const sc_spawn_options* opt_p );
00135 
00136     virtual const char* kind() const
00137         { return "sc_method_process"; }
00138 
00139   protected:
00140     void check_for_throws();
00141     virtual void disable_process(
00142         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00143     virtual void enable_process(
00144         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00145     inline bool run_process();
00146     virtual void kill_process(
00147         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00148     sc_method_handle next_exist();
00149     sc_method_handle next_runnable();
00150     void clear_trigger();
00151     void next_trigger( const sc_event& );
00152     void next_trigger( const sc_event_or_list& );
00153     void next_trigger( const sc_event_and_list& );
00154     void next_trigger( const sc_time& );
00155     void next_trigger( const sc_time&, const sc_event& );
00156     void next_trigger( const sc_time&, const sc_event_or_list& );
00157     void next_trigger( const sc_time&, const sc_event_and_list& );
00158     virtual void resume_process(
00159         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00160     void set_next_exist( sc_method_handle next_p );
00161     void set_next_runnable( sc_method_handle next_p );
00162     void set_stack_size( std::size_t size );
00163     virtual void suspend_process( 
00164         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00165     virtual void throw_reset( bool async );
00166     virtual void throw_user( const sc_throw_it_helper& helper,
00167         sc_descendant_inclusion_info descendants = SC_NO_DESCENDANTS );
00168     bool trigger_dynamic( sc_event* );
00169     inline void trigger_static();
00170 
00171   protected:
00172     sc_cor*                          m_cor;        // Thread's coroutine.
00173     std::size_t                      m_stack_size; // Thread stack size.
00174     std::vector<sc_process_monitor*> m_monitor_q;  // Thread monitors.
00175 
00176   private:
00177     // may not be deleted manually (called from sc_process_b)
00178     virtual ~sc_method_process();
00179 
00180   private: // disabled
00181     sc_method_process( const sc_method_process& );
00182     const sc_method_process& operator = ( const sc_method_process& );
00183 
00184 };

00186 inline
00187 void
00188 sc_method_process::next_trigger( const sc_event& e )
00189 {
00190     clear_trigger();
00191     e.add_dynamic( this );
00192     m_event_p = &e;
00193     m_trigger_type = EVENT;
00194 }
00195 
00196 inline
00197 void
00198 sc_method_process::next_trigger( const sc_event_or_list& el )
00199 {
00200     clear_trigger();
00201     el.add_dynamic( this );
00202     m_event_list_p = &el;
00203     m_trigger_type = OR_LIST;
00204 }
00205 
00206 inline
00207 void
00208 sc_method_process::next_trigger( const sc_event_and_list& el )
00209 {
00210     clear_trigger();
00211     el.add_dynamic( this );
00212     m_event_list_p = &el;
00213     m_event_count = el.size();
00214     m_trigger_type = AND_LIST;
00215 }
00216 
00217 inline
00218 void
00219 sc_method_process::next_trigger( const sc_time& t )
00220 {
00221     clear_trigger();
00222     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00223     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00224     m_trigger_type = TIMEOUT;
00225 }
00226 
00227 inline
00228 void
00229 sc_method_process::next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event& e )
00230 {
00231     clear_trigger();
00232     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00233     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00234     e.add_dynamic( this );
00235     m_event_p = &e;
00236     m_trigger_type = EVENT_TIMEOUT;
00237 }
00238 
00239 inline
00240 void
00241 sc_method_process::next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_or_list& el )
00242 {
00243     clear_trigger();
00244     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00245     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00246     el.add_dynamic( this );
00247     m_event_list_p = &el;
00248     m_trigger_type = OR_LIST_TIMEOUT;
00249 }
00250 
00251 inline
00252 void
00253 sc_method_process::next_trigger( const sc_time& t, const sc_event_and_list& el )
00254 {
00255     clear_trigger();
00256     m_timeout_event_p->notify_internal( t );
00257     m_timeout_event_p->add_dynamic( this );
00258     el.add_dynamic( this );
00259     m_event_list_p = &el;
00260     m_event_count = el.size();
00261     m_trigger_type = AND_LIST_TIMEOUT;
00262 }

00289 // +----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00290 // |"sc_method_process::run_process"
00291 // | 
00292 // | This method executes this object instance, including fielding exceptions.
00293 // |
00294 // | Result is false if an unfielded exception occurred, true if not.
00295 // +----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00296 inline bool sc_method_process::run_process()
00297 {
00298     // Execute this object instance's semantics and catch any exceptions that
00299     // are generated:
00300 
00301     bool restart = false;
00302     do {
00303         try {
00304             DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,this,"executing method semantics");
00305             semantics();
00306             restart = false;
00307         }
00308         catch( sc_unwind_exception& ex ) {
00309             DEBUG_MSG(DEBUG_NAME,this,"caught unwind exception");
00310             ex.clear();
00311             restart = ex.is_reset();
00312         }
00313         catch( ... ) {
00314             sc_report* err_p = sc_handle_exception();
00315             simcontext()->set_error( err_p );
00316             return false;
00317         }
00318     } while( restart );
00319 
00320     return true;
00321 }
00322 
00323 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00324 //"sc_method_process::trigger_static"
00325 //
00326 // This inline method adds the current method to the queue of runnable
00327 // processes, if required.  This is the case if the following criteria
00328 // are met:
00329 //   (1) The process is in a runnable state.
00330 //   (2) The process is not already on the run queue.
00331 //   (3) The process is expecting a static trigger, 
00332 //       dynamic event waits take priority.
00333 //
00334 //
00335 // If the triggering process is the same process, the trigger is
00336 // ignored as well, unless SC_ENABLE_IMMEDIATE_SELF_NOTIFICATIONS
00337 // is defined.
00338 //------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00339 inline
00340 void
00341 sc_method_process::trigger_static()
00342 {
00343     if ( (m_state & ps_bit_disabled) || is_runnable() ||
00344           m_trigger_type != STATIC )
00345         return;
00346 
00347 #if ! defined( SC_ENABLE_IMMEDIATE_SELF_NOTIFICATIONS )
00348     if( SC_UNLIKELY_( sc_get_current_process_b() == this ) )
00349     {
00350         report_immediate_self_notification();
00351         return;
00352     }
00353 #endif // SC_ENABLE_IMMEDIATE_SELF_NOTIFICATIONS
00354 
00355     // If we get here then the method is has satisfied its wait, if its 
00356     // suspended mark its state as ready to run. If its not suspended then 
00357     // push it onto the runnable queue.
00358 
00359     if ( m_state & ps_bit_suspended )
00360     {
00361         m_state = m_state | ps_bit_ready_to_run;
00362     }
00363     else
00364     {
00365         simcontext()->push_runnable_method(this);
00366     }
00367 }
00368 
00369 #undef DEBUG_MSG
